cost_of_living.overall_index: Very low, 30-40% of Western European costs

visas.remarks:
üá¶üá± Low income threshold & simple online process.
‚Ä¢ The 'Unique Permit' officially covers digital nomads.
‚Ä¢ After 5 years, you can apply for permanent residency. 
‚Ä¢ Becomes tax resident after 183 days.

visas.bonuses_incentives: 10% flat tax, low cost of living.
visas.remarks:
üáßüá¨ Great for those seeking a low-tax EU base.
‚Ä¢ Official government application details are still less clear than in other countries.
‚Ä¢ Must apply in person at a Bulgarian consulate.

‚òÄÔ∏è Major benefit is income tax exemption on foreign earnings.
‚Ä¢ Income requirement increases by 10% for each family member.
‚Ä¢ You cannot reapply for a consecutive year immediately after the first permit expires.

visas.visa_length: Initial visa up to 1 year, convertible to a renewable residence permit.
visas.bonuses_incentives: 10% flat income tax, full Schengen Area mobility, low cost of living.
visas.remarks:
üáßüá¨ New visa as of mid-2024! 
‚Ä¢ Key benefit: full Schengen Area access and a very low 10% flat income tax. 
‚Ä¢ Requirement is to earn 3x the country's average salary (approx. ‚Ç¨1,300/month). 
‚Ä¢ Must apply in person at a Bulgarian consulate for the initial Type D visa.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No income tax if taxed elsewhere.
visas.remarks:
‚ö†Ô∏è The program has a strict cap of 500 permits.
‚Ä¢ Must apply in person within 3 months of arriving in Cyprus.
‚Ä¢ Income requirement increases by 20% for a spouse, 15% for each child.

üõ†Ô∏è This is a trade license, not a dedicated nomad visa.
‚Ä¢ Process is complex and often requires hiring an agent.
‚Ä¢ Based on proving savings (~$5,350), not monthly income.

üíª A pioneer in digital government.
‚Ä¢ High income requirement, must show proof for 6 months prior.
‚Ä¢ Processing is highly efficient (usually 15-30 days).

üá´üá∑ This is a visitor visa, not a work visa.
‚Ä¢ Prohibits work for a French company, but remote work for foreign employers is tolerated.
‚Ä¢ You must sign a declaration not to engage in professional activity in France.

cost_of_living.overall_index: Very low, 30-40% of Western European costs

visas.remarks:
üõë Program is inactive; official portal is inaccessible.
‚Ä¢ Many nationalities can enter visa-free for up to 1 year anyway.
‚Ä¢ Tax-friendly: 1% tax for small businesses.

üá©üá™ Not a nomad visa, but a path for freelancers.
‚Ä¢ Requires proof of 'local economic interest' (e.g., letters of intent from German clients).
‚Ä¢ Process is known to be complex and bureaucratic.

visas.bonuses_incentives: 50% tax break for up to 7 years.
visas.remarks:
üèõÔ∏è Generous tax break is a major draw.
‚Ä¢ Income requirement increases by 20% for a spouse and 15% per child.
‚Ä¢ Application must be made at a Greek consulate in your country of residence.

üë§ Strictly for individuals; no family inclusion allowed.
‚Ä¢ Straightforward online application via 'Enter Hungary' portal.
‚Ä¢ New, higher income requirement of ‚Ç¨3,000/month as of July 2025.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No tax if stay is less than 183 days.
visas.remarks:
‚ùÑÔ∏è Ideal for a short-term, unique experience.
‚Ä¢ Very high income requirement.
‚Ä¢ Visa is non-renewable, you must leave after 6 months.

‚ùå No digital nomad visa currently exists.
‚Ä¢ Alternative visa options are not suitable for remote work for foreign companies. Plans have been discussed but not implemented.

visas.visa_name: Visa for Remote Workers and Digital Nomads
visas.visa_length: 1 year with the possibility to extend
visas.remarks:
üéì Requires 'highly skilled worker' status (degree or 3-5 years' high-level experience).
‚Ä¢ Must apply in person at an Italian consulate.
‚Ä¢ Within 8 days of arrival, must apply for a residence permit (Permesso di Soggiorno).

visas.eligible_citizens: Non-EU nationals employed in OECD countries
visas.remarks:
üåê Eligibility is restricted to citizens or employees of companies in OECD countries.
‚Ä¢ Relatively high income requirement for the region.
‚Ä¢ Application must be done in person at a Latvian consulate.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No local tax if taxed elsewhere.
visas.remarks:
üá≤üáπ Fully remote application process.
‚Ä¢ Tax-exempt if you maintain tax residency elsewhere.
‚Ä¢ Income requirements increase for any accompanying family members.

üèîÔ∏è Long duration: stay up to 4 years.
‚Ä¢ Program is active and applications are open.
‚Ä¢ Low income requirement makes it very accessible.

visas.bonuses_incentives: Can register business and work freelance.
visas.remarks:
üå∑ This is an alternative path, not a true nomad visa.
‚Ä¢ Requires a points-based assessment of your business plan and its value to the Dutch economy.
‚Ä¢ Application must be made at a Dutch embassy.
‚è≥ Program has been announced but official requirements and a launch date have not been confirmed. Details are subject to change.

üêª‚Äç‚ùÑÔ∏è Not a visa program; a unique treaty allows visa-free residency.
‚Ä¢ You must prove self-sufficiency to reside there.
‚Ä¢ Entry via mainland Norway may require a separate Schengen visa.

visas.visa_length: 4-month visa, converted to a 2-year residence permit, renewable up to 5 years
visas.bonuses_incentives: Schengen access, path to permanent residency and citizenship.
visas.remarks:
üáµüáπ Very popular option with a clear path to residency.
‚Ä¢ Income requirement is 4x the Portuguese minimum wage.
‚Ä¢ Process can be slow, taking 3-6 months.

visas.visa_length: 4-months visa, converted to a 2-year residence permit, renewable
visas.bonuses_incentives: Healthcare and Schengen access; path to permanent residency.
visas.remarks:
üí∞ For those with passive income, not active remote work.
‚Ä¢ Lower income requirement than the D8 visa.
‚Ä¢ A good alternative for retirees or investors.

üßõ Low cost of living and fast internet speeds.
‚Ä¢ Income requirement is 3x the average Romanian gross salary.
‚Ä¢ Can be applied for online or at an embassy.

‚è≥ Program announced but not yet fully implemented.
‚Ä¢ Key details are still subject to change upon official launch.
‚Ä¢ High proposed income requirement.

visas.visa_length: Initial 1 year; renew up to 5 years
visas.bonuses_incentives: Special tax regime, family inclusion, path to long-term residency.
visas.remarks:
üá™üá∏ Path to long-term residency and special tax regime.
‚Ä¢ Income requirement: 200% of Spain's Minimum Interprofessional Salary (SMI).
‚Ä¢ Can be applied for in Spain or at a consulate.

visas.visa_length: Initial 12 months; extensions depend on canton
visas.remarks:
üèîÔ∏è Extremely difficult to obtain for non-EU citizens.
‚Ä¢ Requires proving your business serves a Swiss economic interest.
‚Ä¢ Not a practical option for most digital nomads.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No income proof; path to permanent residency.
visas.remarks:
üá¶üá≤ Path to residency by registering as a sole proprietor.
‚Ä¢ No explicit income requirement, making it very accessible.
‚Ä¢ After 3 years of residency, you can apply for citizenship (requires a language/civics test).

visas.visa_length: Initially 30 days, can be extended up to 1 year
visas.remarks:
üá∞üá≠ Popular unofficial route for long-term stays.
‚Ä¢ The E-class visa can be extended indefinitely (most use the 'EB' extension).
‚Ä¢ Using a local visa agent is highly recommended for extensions.

visas.visa_length: Up to 5 years (180-day limit per visit)
visas.eligible_citizens: Citizens of eligible countries for e-Visa
visas.remarks:
‚ö†Ô∏è Alternative Pathway: Remote work is officially not permitted on a Tourist Visa.
‚Ä¢ Length reflects max stay per visit (180 days for most nationalities).
‚Ä¢ No official digital nomad visa exists yet.

üå¥ The official 'Second Home' visa for remote workers in Bali & beyond.
‚Ä¢ High income requirement of $60,000/year.
‚Ä¢ You are exempt from paying taxes on income sourced from outside Indonesia.

visas.eligible_citizens: Nationals of 49 countries with tax treaties or visa-free agreements
visas.bonuses_incentives: Exempt from Japanese income tax on foreign earnings.
visas.remarks:
üáØüáµ Short-term visa for specific nationalities.
‚Ä¢ Cannot be renewed; must leave Japan for 6 months before reapplying.
‚Ä¢ Must apply in person at a Japanese embassy or consulate.

üá≤üáæ Low income requirement and straightforward online process.
‚Ä¢ An additional fee of RM 500 (~$110) applies for each dependent.
‚Ä¢ Tax-exempt on foreign-sourced income.

visas.bonuses_incentives: Exempt from income tax on foreign earnings.
visas.remarks:
‚úÖ Recently approved, but rollout details are still pending.
‚Ä¢ Official income requirement is exceptionally low at $2,000/year.
‚Ä¢ Applications will be handled via the e-Visa portal once live.

visas.bonuses_incentives: Cannot work for a local company.
visas.remarks:
üá∞üá∑ High-tech infrastructure and vibrant culture.
‚Ä¢ High income requirement (double South Korea's GNI per capita).
‚Ä¢ Application must be done in person at a Korean embassy.
‚è≥ The government has announced intentions to launch a nomad visa, but it is not yet implemented. Keep an eye on official immigration channels for updates.

visas.bonuses_incentives: Exempt from Taiwan's income tax on foreign earnings.
visas.remarks:
üíº For highly skilled professionals, not a simple nomad visa.
‚Ä¢ Requires proving expertise in specific fields (e.g., Science, Technology, Economy).
‚Ä¢ Offers open work rights and a path to residency.

visas.bonuses_incentives: Reduced 17% tax. Most nomads use a tourist visa instead.

cost_of_living.overall_index: Low to medium, 40-60% of Western costs

visas.remarks:
üí∞ For high-income professionals and investors.
‚Ä¢ Very high income requirement ($80k/year).
‚Ä¢ A premium option for those seeking long-term stability and tax benefits.

visas.visa_length: 180 days, extendable for another 180 days (5 years total validity)
visas.bonuses_incentives: No work permit required for remote work.

cost_of_living.overall_index: Low to medium, 40-60% of Western costs

visas.remarks:
üéâ Thailand's newest visa for nomads!
‚Ä¢ Allows a 180-day stay, extendable once within the country.
‚Ä¢ Requires proof of ~$13,500 in savings. Much more accessible than the LTR.

visas.bonuses_incentives: Tax-free status for stays under 183 days.
visas.remarks:
üáπüá∑ Great option but has restrictions.
‚Ä¢ Eligibility is limited by age (21-55) and to 36 specific countries (most of EU, UK, USA, Canada).
‚Ä¢ Apply online, then visit a consulate to finalize.

visas.bonuses_incentives: 0% income tax. Resident ID and access to public services.
visas.remarks:
üá¶üá™ Enjoy a 0% income tax rate.
‚Ä¢ The visa applies to all Emirates, not just Dubai.
‚Ä¢ Additional fees for medical tests and the Emirates ID are required.

visas.eligible_citizens: Citizens of most countries are eligible.
visas.bonuses_incentives: Low cost of living, vibrant nomad community.
visas.remarks:
üçú Not a dedicated nomad visa, but the 90-day e-visa is a common choice.
‚Ä¢ For longer stays, 'visa runs' (leaving and re-entering the country) are common practice.
‚Ä¢ Remote work is tolerated but not officially sanctioned.

üá¶üá¨ Enjoy 0% personal income tax in a Caribbean paradise.
‚Ä¢ Straightforward online application.
‚Ä¢ Fees are tiered: $1,500 for an individual, $2,000 for a couple, and $3,000 for a family of 3+.

visas.bonuses_incentives: Access to healthcare and social services.
visas.remarks:
üá¶üá∑ Extremely low cost of living due to currency situation.
‚Ä¢ No specific income requirement, but you must prove sufficient funds (est. ~$2,500/month).
‚Ä¢ Apply online, then finalize at an Argentine consulate.

üèùÔ∏è This is a program for tourists, not a formal visa.
‚Ä¢ No application fee is required.
‚Ä¢ Only available to nationals who do not require a visa to enter Aruba for tourism.

visas.bonuses_incentives: English-speaking; no taxes on foreign income.
visas.remarks:
üê† High income requirement but tax-free on foreign earnings.
‚Ä¢ Entirely online application process.
‚Ä¢ Family income requirement is $100,000 per year.

üáßüá∑ Low income requirement of $1,500/month or $18,000 in savings.
‚Ä¢ Must apply in person at a Brazilian consulate.
‚Ä¢ Visa fee can vary significantly based on your nationality.

‚ùå This program is permanently closed to new applicants.
‚Ä¢ It had a very high income requirement and application fee.
‚Ä¢ Was known for its 0% tax and luxury lifestyle.

üá®üá¥ Very low income requirement (3x Colombia's minimum wage).
‚Ä¢ Straightforward online application process.
‚Ä¢ You cannot work for any Colombian company on this visa.

pura vida! üå¥ This visa offers a full exemption from local income tax.
‚Ä¢ Application is online, but the process can be slow (3-6 months).
‚Ä¢ Family income requirement is $4,000/month.

üá®üáº No specific income requirement, but you must prove you can support yourself.
‚Ä¢ Quick and easy online application process.
‚Ä¢ You remain a tax resident of your home country.

üçÉ Live and work in the 'Nature Isle' of the Caribbean.
‚Ä¢ High application fee ($800 visa fee + $100 application fee).
‚Ä¢ Family bundle visa costs $1,200.

üá™üá® Very low cost of living and uses the US dollar.
‚Ä¢ Low income requirement (3x Ecuador's basic salary).
‚Ä¢ $400 visa fee plus a $50 application fee.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No income, capital gains, or property tax on foreign assets.
visas.remarks:
‚Çø The first country to make Bitcoin legal tender.
‚Ä¢ Very high application fee.
‚Ä¢ The visa promises 0% tax on income and a path to citizenship.

üá¨üá© Live on the 'Island of Spice'.
‚Ä¢ High application fee: $1,500 for individuals, $2,000 for families.
‚Ä¢ You are exempt from paying local income tax.

üåÆ Not a nomad visa, but a popular temporary residency path.
‚Ä¢ Must apply in person at a Mexican consulate outside of Mexico.
‚Ä¢ Income requirements vary significantly by consulate, check locally!

üåã Live on a quiet Caribbean island with an active volcano.
‚Ä¢ High income requirement of $70,000/year.
‚Ä¢ Application fee is $500 for individuals, $750 for families.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No taxes on foreign income; U.S. dollar economy.
visas.remarks:
‚öñÔ∏è You must hire a Panamanian immigration lawyer to handle the application.
‚Ä¢ 0% tax on foreign-sourced income.
‚Ä¢ The official economy uses the U.S. Dollar.

üáµüá™ Recently launched! Details are still emerging.
‚Ä¢ Low income requirement makes it very accessible.
‚Ä¢ Allows you to work remotely without becoming a Peruvian tax resident.

visas.visa_length: 90 days (under ESTA) or indefinitely for US citizens
visas.eligible_citizens: US citizens or those with US work authorization.
visas.bonuses_incentives: Tax incentives under Act 60 for residents.
visas.remarks:
üá∫üá∏ Not a visa, but a US territory.
‚Ä¢ No visa needed for US citizens. Foreigners follow standard US entry rules (e.g., ESTA).
‚Ä¢ Major tax incentives under Act 60 for those who become residents.

üá±üá® This is a multiple-entry visa designed for remote work.
‚Ä¢ No specific income requirement, but must prove you can support yourself.
‚Ä¢ Low application fee makes it an attractive option.

üá∫üáæ Unique for its lack of a specific income requirement.
‚Ä¢ You only need to sign a sworn affidavit promising self-sufficiency.
‚Ä¢ After the initial permit, you can apply for a 2-year temporary residency.

visas.eligible_citizens: Citizens of eligible partner countries, aged 18-30 or 18-35.

cost_of_living.overall_index: Very high, among world's most expensive

visas.remarks:
üá¶üá∫ This is a youth travel visa, not a nomad visa.
‚Ä¢ Strict age (18-35) and nationality requirements apply.
‚Ä¢ Requires proof of sufficient funds (~$3,300 USD) and a return ticket.

visas.eligible_citizens: Citizens of North America, Europe, CPLP, and ECOWAS
visas.bonuses_incentives: No local income tax on foreign earnings.
visas.remarks:
üá®üáª Island life with a low cost of living.
‚Ä¢ Eligibility is restricted to citizens from Europe, North America, CPLP, and ECOWAS countries.
‚Ä¢ Income requirement for a family is ‚Ç¨2,700/month.

üè∫ Not a work visa, but a long-term tourist visa.
‚Ä¢ Remote work is tolerated but not officially sanctioned.
‚Ä¢ High up-front cost, but provides 5 years of multiple-entry access.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No local income tax on foreign earnings.
visas.remarks:
üá≤üá∫ This visa is completely free to apply for!
‚Ä¢ Low income requirement ($1,500/month for individual).
‚Ä¢ Dependents require an extra $500/month each in income.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No local income tax on foreign earnings for stays under 183 days.
visas.remarks:
üá≤üá¶ Common unofficial nomad base.
‚Ä¢ Most nationalities can enter visa-free for 90 days.
‚Ä¢ A formal digital nomad visa has been announced but is not yet implemented.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No local income tax on foreign earnings.
visas.remarks:
üá≥üá¶ Explore stunning desert landscapes while you work.
‚Ä¢ Income requirements increase by $1,000/month for a spouse and $500/month per child.
‚Ä¢ Straightforward online application process.

visas.visa_length: Up to 12 or 23 months depending on nationality.
visas.eligible_citizens: Citizens from eligible countries, aged 18-30 or 18-35.
visas.remarks:
ü•ù For young travelers, not a true nomad visa.
‚Ä¢ Primary purpose must be tourism, with work being incidental.
‚Ä¢ Strict age (18-35) and nationality requirements apply.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No local income tax on foreign earnings.
visas.remarks:
üá∏üá® Simple, low-cost application for a slice of paradise.
‚Ä¢ No specific income requirement, but must show proof of funds.
‚Ä¢ Applicant must have valid medical and travel insurance.

visas.bonuses_incentives: No local income tax on foreign earnings under 183 days.
visas.remarks:
üáøüá¶ Newly launched! Applications opened in June 2024.
‚Ä¢ Must earn over R55,000/month (~$3000 USD).
‚Ä¢ You become a tax resident if you stay over 183 days in a year.
